definitions: fix (something) to something else with a peg or pegs.
mark (a score or a place) with a peg.
hit (a ball or a disc) with a hard throw.
identify (someone or something) as belonging to a particular group or having a particular quality.
examples: He pegged the tent to the ground.
She pegged the score at 10 points.
The catcher pegged the runner at second.
They had to peg away at the problem.
He was pegged as a future leader.
